Our practice further extends to a plethora of Business Consulting Services all geared towards helping corporate organizations excel in a highly challenging business environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Supervisor

Job Location: Ajaokuta, Kogi 
Reporting To: Head of Engineering
Industry: Manufacturing / Building Materials

About the Role
     

            
    




	We are expanding our team and seeking a qualified and experienced Project Supervisor to oversee operations at our Ajaokuta Plant.
	The role is responsible for creating daily and weekly work plans that outline all site activities and execution timelines, supervising on-site work according to project specifications and documenting all progress.
	Monitor construction or installation quality, ensuring alignment with engineering and safety standards.
	Manage and direct contractors and subcontractors, enforcing proper use of PPE and work-at-height protocols and conduct daily safety briefings, issue permits, assess risks, and implement mitigation strategies.


Experience & Key Responsibilities


	Create a detailed work plan of day to day activities which identifies and sequences the activities needed to successfully complete the project.
	Supervise and execute the project as per the approved plan. Maintain secure and organized documentation.
	Supervise and review the site and the quality of the work completed by the contractors with the project team regularly to ensure that it meets the project standards.
	Direct and supervise contractors for safe execution, ensuring proper use of PPE and height safety practices.
	Ensure safety norms are strictly followed. Daily checking issuing the work permits, risks identification and mitigation plans are implemented. Ensure a safe working environment for all project personnel.
	Coordination for the resources like Material handling equipment, Lifting requirements, civil requirements, etc., coordinating with stakeholders and plan for the better utilization of resources.
	Strong understanding of industry regulations, safety standards, and risk mitigation strategies for supervision and safe execution of projects.
	Plan for shutdown managements in coordination with user departments without effecting the project schedules. Follow isolation procedures and execution at site.
	Should fully understand the scope of the project, identify the major milestones and set clear priorities for the contractor team to complete the project tasks.
	Escalating to project manager about all abnormal developments with respect to progress of work, safety, quality, resources etc.
	Daily toolbox meeting with Contractors, Coordination with OEM technicians during erection and commissioning..


Requirements


	Mechanical Engineering / Electrical Engineering
	Minimum 5 years of expereince in Manufacturing Industry/ Building material Industry
	Strong project supervision, planning, and execution skills
	Excellent manpower and scheduling management abilities
	Skilled at increasing workforce productivity during execution
	Capable of managing multiple tasks and sections within a factory
	Technically aware of civil, electro-mechanical, and architectural works
	Willingness to work extra hours during critical project phases.


Salary
Very Attractive.

Method of Application

Civil Engineer Job at Team Nigeria




        
    

        
        Team Nigeria is a part of TEAM Group an internationally renowned consultancy Company specialized in engineering, urban planning, and architecture. With main offices on three continents, we capitalize on our longstanding experience, expertise, and highly qualified international team of dedicated professionals to deliver state-of-the-art services to both private and public clients. Vast regions of the world are now interconnected by development flows and international corridors. This is the sphere in which we operate and wish to offer our professional contribution.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Civil Engineer
     

            
    



Job Location: Kano, Nigeria
Employment type: Full time
Department: Engineering

Job Summary


	Are you a results-driven Civil Engineer with a passion for infrastructure and transport systems? T.E.A.M Nigeria Ltd. is seeking a dedicated and experienced Civil Engineer to join our supervision team on the Kano-Maradi-Dutse Railway Project, Kano State.
	In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing civil construction activities on-site, ensuring that works comply with approved drawings, engineering standards, safety regulations, and the broader project objectives.
	This is an excellent opportunity to be part of a major national railway project, contributing to the delivery of sustainable transport solutions in Nigeria.


Job Description?


	Supervise on-site civil works, ensuring quality, compliance, and adherence to design specifications.
	Review, interpret, and validate civil, structural, and architectural drawings.
	Identify and resolve technical or construction-related issues promptly.
	Coordinate effectively with contractors, consultants, and project stakeholders to ensure smooth execution of site activities.
	Monitor construction progress and provide accurate daily and weekly site reports.
	Support quality assurance and health & safety enforcement on site.
	Assist in verifying contractor’s work and validating quantities for payment certification.
	Ensure that project timelines, standards, and budgets are maintained.


Job Requirements


	Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Civil Engineering from a recognized institution.
	Minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in project construction and site supervision.
	Strong command of construction methods and engineering standards.
	Proficiency in AutoCAD, MS Office, and engineering design software.
	Demonstrated leadership, problem-solving, and communication skills.
	Ability to thrive under challenging site conditions and adapt to extended work hours.
	Excellent documentation, reporting, and interpersonal skills.
	COREN registration (preferred).

title: Job Vacancies at Maywood Lending Limited
content:
Maywood Lending Limited is a financial organization dedicated to meeting the financial needs of citizens across Nigeria by providing accessible loan services whenever our customers require financial support.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Junior Accountant

Job Location: Agidingbi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a professional with solid accounting skills and expertise in tax filing to join our team.
	As an Accountant, you will assist in managing the company's financial operations, including bookkeeping, tax filing and payments, and audit reconciliation.


Key Responsibilities


	Record transactions based on bank statements and reconcile bank deposit balances
	Submit monthly and annual tax filings on time, including personal income tax, value-added tax, withholding tax, corporate income tax, and other statutory tax types
	Organize and archive monthly expense invoices, tax filing documents, and payment receipts
	Assist the Finance Manager in implementing and promoting financial management processes through the company's financial management system, including approving external payments and employee reimbursement processes
	Coordinate with auditors on the annual audit report to ensure the smooth completion of the annual corporate income tax filing
	Monitor industry tax policies and provide professional insights to the Finance Manager
	Ensure compliance with Nigerian tax regulations and laws


Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field
	At least 2 years of relevant work experience
	Professional certification (e.g., ACA, ACCA, ICAN) is a plus.
	Familiarity with accounting principles, tax regulations, and financial guidelines
	Proficient in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP) is a plus.
	Strong analytical, communication, and organizational skills.


We Offer:


	
	Pre-tax Salary: N180,000 - N230,000 (including base salary, performance bonus, seniority allowance, and transportation subsidy)
	


Application Closing Date: 31st January, 2026.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: idowu@maywood.com.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
